name: Aelynthi, the Deadly (Bard 7 / Arcane Archer 23 / RDD 10)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Aelynthi, the Deadly (Bard 7 / Arcane Archer 23 / RDD 10)




Source: http://www.fanpop.com/clubs/fantasy/ima ... cher-photo

Other Bard/AA/RDD Builds:
Devastating Arcane Archer by Tulians (Bard 5/RDD 10/AA 25) - http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 17561.html
Power Archer (Bard 6/RDD 11/AA 23) - http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 39460.html
Drakebow (Bard 7/RDD 10/AA 23) - http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 03520.html
The Real True Ultimate Archer: Bard7/RDD10/AA23 - http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 62070.html
Dragon Scaled Shards, Rysta'tia Magicia ( Bard7 / RDD10 / AA23 ) - http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 83701.html

Devastating Archer build (in work) Bard(8), RDD(10), Arcane Archer(22) - devastating-archer-build-in-work-t2296712.html
Empyre65's Bard/RDD/AA Devastating Archer series of builds for Aielund, Sands of Fate and Mines of Twin Summit - self-sufficient-builds-moved-from-high- ... tml#p16821

Lore regarding the Vesve Forest:
https://post-greyhawk-wars-585-cy.obsid ... sve-forest

Lore regarding Grand Priestess Halga, the Favourite of Iuz, of the Greater Boneheart Order:
https://greyhawkonline.com/iuz/ - description regarding Halga's appearance borrowed from here

Lore:
Aelynthi Orileth, second born and daughter of Tanithil and Delimira, high elven sages of the Calarel tribe in the Vesve Forest, was raised to preserve the history of her heritage by transforming it into song.

Yet in the high vantage points of the Forest, she saw smoke and fire, heard the scurrying normally fearless stags of the forest running in fear, felt the pain of the trees as humanoids were desecrating her sacred lands - a raging war was brewing between the human and allied folk of Furyondy, and the terrifying armies of chaotic evil demi-god Iuz.

Returning back to her studies she discovered that the transfusion of the blood of red dragon wyrmlings could imbue potent properties into the receiver, but also cause one to suffer a terrible, painful and gruesome death, or even worse - transformation into a mindless blind red dragon half-breed with no memory of his or her past life, and who will only seek to go to the nearest nest of a female Red Dragon, fighting and destroying everything that gets in their way... 

As the advancing armies of Iuz start to build spawning sites, clearing more and more of the forest, and the armies of Furyondy chop down trees to build wooden pallisades to defend against Iuz's advance, Aelynthi's tribe recognises their home will soon be at risk as the forces of Iuz inching ever closer.

Word goes out to the forces of Furyondy that aid is required, yet no aid arrives. The Furyondy armies are either too pre-occupied, or too busy.

An urgent council meeting is held, all potential options are discussed, and it appears the tribe is cornered by the forces of Iuz. The only way out, is to cut their way through the Orcish Armies led by the Battlepriests of Iuz. The supplies of Red Dragon Wyrmling blood are collected by Aelynthi from all the villagers for safe keeping and kept on her person. The commander in chief of the Calarel tribe, Aelynthi's oldest brother, Elnaril volunteers to undergo the transfusion ritual, for the sake of his homeland, scheduled for the next morning.

And yet, unbeknownst to all in attendance, an agent of Iuz was amongst the council meeting. 

Neglected and forgotten by their family and tribe in the blinding eminence of the siblings Elnaril and Aelynthi, the youngest brother Ehrendil watches with disdain at his elder siblings 'heroic' actions. 

Bullied by Elnaril through his upbringing, and constant arguments with Aelynthi about his unorthodox and at times unethical 'ways', he has only experienced bitterness and injury to his ego. Slinking out stealthly from the meeting, he approaches a forest glade, and weave a mystic sigil on a rotten decaying tree stump. 

And out of the fog of the misty forest, the image of Grand Battle-Priestess Halga the Oppressor of the Greater Boneheart Order of Iuz appears. 

Clad in vestments of rust red, trimmed in black and wielding an ebon staff bound in silver with a sliver set skull, she smiles as she promises the traitorous Ehrendil protection, power, wealth and privilege in exchange for information on the villages defences. 

And Ehrendil, no sense of loyalty remaining to his family, his village or homeland through the neglect over decades and centuries of an elven lifespan, doesn't hesitate, for in his own mind there is only the villages' destruction to the forces of Iuz, and this is his only ticket for survival. His sister's plan of magical red dragon blood saving them just sounds insane.

Whispering the villages plans to Halga, the Favourite of Iuz smiles broadly. But then Ehrendil notices her smile vanish. 

Halga whispers to him, and combined with his elven keen senses he knows someone is listening. Halga silently weaves an incantation, and his dagger starts to burn with a radiant blue fire. Coldfire he recalls, the incantation cast. Halga looks at him and nods. Without even turning he throws the dagger at the person watching him. 

And he sees his sister Aelynthi falling from the trees, dagger in her chest, screaming with all the bardic might she can muster, the dagger barely missing her heart, but a mortal wound nonetheless.

Seeing his least detested sibling lying on the ground he feels a twang of guilt briefly, then sighs. There is nothing left for him in this village anymore. 

Halga beckons to him, weaves a second incantation, and a yawning portal opens. Time to collect your reward, she smiles. And the arriving elven forces, look startled as there is a flash of light high in the treetops. Ehrendil vanishes, with no plan to ever return, and believing his tribe will shortly be utterly devastated into oblivion.

Elnaril glances at her fallen sister, the icy chill of the cold fire starting to spread across her torso, death imminent. 

She glances at him, opening her right hand containing the vial of red dragon wyrmling blood, and the transfusion instrument. 

'Let me go' she says. 'Save the village with this power, do it now'.

And Elnaril grasps the vial and transfusion instrument from his sibling, his ally over centuries, his stauchest and loyalist advocate in the village. 

He owes her so much, over so many years...

He sees her slowly slip into unconsciousness... 

Paradoxically smiling, for she believes he is destined to become their saviour, the villages fate safe with the greatest elven general the Verve forest has ever known

And he primes the transfusion instrument... 

...and plunges it into her heart.

A glowing fire starts to burn around her, cleansing away the demonic coldfire robbing her of her life force. Draconic scales start to meld into her skin.

The elven clerics begin to chant healing magic.

And in the silent darkness of night, Aelynthi's condition stabilises.


.....


Elnaril has a sleepless night. Watching for signs of his sisters recovery, praying for signs of his sisters recovery. 

He could have doomed the entire village at the expense of his sisters life. He was just so selfish, he berates himself. He couldn't let go. 

He prays to Corellion, to Selene, to all the gods he knows that she awakens before dawn.

And before sunrise her eyes open. She glances sadly at her brother. 

'You have saved my life' Aelynthi says, 'but I am no warrior. The power of the Red Dragon Blood is wasted on me. We may all die anyway.'

And Elnaril grins, the grin she knows he does when he is outmatched, outnumbered and with no chance of escape.

With her keen senses hears the warcries and footsteps of the advancing humanoids of Iuz, hellbent on destroying her home, miles away, but approaching.

And Elnaril takes her hand and places it on his legendary longbow Mirathyra. Its nickname, 'The Slayer of Thousands'.

'For the next 12 hours, this longbow belongs to you. Its time you join our forces in battle. And see if this Draconic Blood is any good to us.'

Grasping Elnaril's hand, Aelynthi attempts to stand and does so with surprising strength, knocking the muscular Elnaril to the ground as she pulls herself up. She hears Elnaril gently chuckle as he dusts himself off and stands. 

And as they leave through the door of their abode, she sees the sun is rising in the sky, she hears the birds sing, she smells the familar scent of her home. And as the powerful warmth of the sun falls upon her, she feel her blood stir. The cold, dormant, reptilian power of the red dragon line is starting to surge within her...

And she is ready to defend her homeland...

Features:
AB 53 with mundane longbow
6 attacks per round with Rapid Shot and Haste
+12 arrow enchantment
Devastating Critical (Base DC 37)
350hp, AC 34 without items
Bard Song, UMD to use any spell in the game
Set Trap 15 to use and retrieve nearly all deadly traps with no chance of failure (with bard song and a Cat's Grace potion)
Called Shot and Blind Fight

Weaknesses 
- lowish HP for a warrior (offset by being a ranged character, high AC, buffs and summons from UMD)
- spellcasters (offset by being able to dev crit them from a distance, and UMD for invisibility / greater sanctuary / mantles / breaches / Mords etc)

Credits:
Valerfor for helping improve the build in many ways

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Good story, presentation & overall build, well done Orion.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I like the story, I like the picture, I like the documentation and I like the presentation.
As for the build itself, I like that too!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:We have not had an archer posted here in quite some time
We had four of them in January of this year: Cornflower's Blackstone Archer, Stag's Ultra AB Archer, Eastern Promises's Black Arrow, and my Elven Guardian.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
...And I'm reconsidering posting my first stab at an AA (Monk 11/ Wiz 2/ AA 27) Drow AA/ Monk  in the level 40 forum - after all, she has been tested in-game, and she does work.

Regardless, well done Orion!

EDIT: To be fair the Ultra AB Arcane Archer is actually Hip's build: I just donated it. And @Empyre, I'd still like to see your Persuasive Archer showing his face as well. Just saying...

EDIT 2: I even managed to dig out a screenshot from Aielund...

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:We had four of them in January of this year
It just feels like a long time, and the majority of builds posted are some kind of melee characters.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:It just feels like a long time, and the majority of builds posted are some kind of melee characters.
Your point being...?
To give fair warning, my next line of enquiry is likely to be of a roguish nature - there are a couple of modules out there that look interesting.
On the plus side - what it does mean is that we're getting more builds posted, which can only be a good thing - and due in no small measure to Orion

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote:Your point being...?
It is refreshing to see an archer build now. That's all. Nothing wrong with other builds.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I know, my friend - I was just playing - we deer are renowned for it in the animal kingdom. For the foreseeable future let's all just assume at least 50% of what I say is in jest. That way you can have fun guessing which 50% isn't.

My main thrust, though, was to unlock the builder in you once more. Yes, you drop great contribution builds into the requests of others, so why not make them available in the big boys' and girls' forum for all to enjoy! Same for Empyre and Valerfor actually. There are some beautiful nuggets in the Build Request forum - give them a proper home where folk can find them, please!

(And in case you were wondering, that wasn't in jest.)

Sorry, Orion, seems like a bit of a hijack of an excellent build here - I'll stop now. Promise.

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
What's Stag meant to say is that 1 archer build for 019' is enough & we should return to our regular schedule now.

Bring up the muscle!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: Aye - maybe I'm just getting soft in my dotage. Hit them hard - and hit them often!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Even the Stag reference in the text of the main post wasn't enough to placate the beast within...

(I was proud I was able to sneak that one in)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: It was certainly appreciated, Orion (I did "like" the post, after all - though that wasn't the sole reason, obviously). But no, only a line of mage and cleric heads on spikes would currently placate me (it would appear that I'm having a bad dress day, according to Kalistez, and I take that personally )

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The poor clerics...
“Forget not, never forget that you have promised me to use this silver to become an honest man.... Jean Valjean, my brother: you belong no longer to evil, but to good. It is your soul that I am buying for you. I withdraw it from dark thoughts and from the spirit of perdition, and I give it to God!”

― Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Excellent movie, that one.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Not seen the movie. I read the book ages ago in school. And we called it The Glums, rather than The Miserables. No respect, some students, eh?

And anyway, in no way does that make clerics worthy of praise! So he's buying the man's soul for him and giving it to god - does the man have no choice in this matter? How bloody dare he, the pompous git!

(Sorry, still on a bit of a dress-related harrumph atm.)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote:My main thrust, though, was to unlock the builder in you once more.
No worries, it is still there. But perhaps you are right, maybe I should post more builds.

posts.author: sataricon
posts.content:
Began following this build for my WOG.
Wish me luck.
Only probkem is dhe is very flimsy.

Sent from my SM-A505F using Tapatalk

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Good luck sataricon!

Please note the build is designed for late game power with a particular spike at 30 when devastating critical is obtained.

Pre-epic I expect to be challenging until UMD is high enough to use summons reliably and you get quite a few levels in AA 

Although all builds tend to be somewhat tough early game. It takes a bit of time for the builds to mature and establish their identity and start to be effective.

The cleric zen archer builds listed in the WoG forum are designed for power early game and late game

If you want a zen archer cleric build for maximal lategame power, perhaps Maximillan Kane's Demolition Man is for you?.

demolition-man-cleric-38-monk-1-rogue-1-t515420.html

Being a cleric, it will be stronger than my build early game and probably as strong as my build late, although without devastating critical, he has access to the Implosion Spell, which with Capped Wisdom of 50, and SF/GSF/ESF: Evocation, should be extremely effective if you want some instant death spells. 

Plus one can hit things very effectively with a bow.  General consensus whenever I have asked in the WoG forum about cleric builds is to go Animal and Plant. 

And the Monk gives a ridiculous boost to AC, like to 70 or something like that?

Anyway I am thinking of trying Max's zen archer build at some stage. There are just so many builds to try :)

posts.author: sataricon
posts.content:

Cheers

posts.content:

Hope your flu clears up soon

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Try the Zen Archery Cleric/Monk with a Heavy Crossbow on WoG.

My Machine Gun Preacher build!

I'm experimenting with Paladin/Blackguard sprinkled in.

posts.author: darktooth
posts.content: I’m a bit curious as to why similar builds have different levels of bard? I mean, what’s the deal with the different bard levels?

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Good question! Got any examples?

There may be a few different reasons I can think of right now:
1. Bard spell pre-requisites
2. Skill dumps (ie Tumble/Discipline/Spellcraft)
3. Bard song pre-requisites
4. Maximizing BAB pre-epic (ie the first 20 levels and the amounts of each class determine the BAB of the build)
5. Trying to finish builds on even class levels (ie Fighter, CoT), or odd class levels (ie AA, Rogue, Assassin)

There is possibly more but happy to look through some examples if you have them

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
darktooth wrote: ↑
Jul 24, 2020
I’m a bit curious as to why similar builds have different levels of bard? I mean, what’s the deal with the different bard levels?
It (mainly) depends if the builder tries to maximize Bard's song/ Curse song or tries for pure AB/Dmg from AA. There's also the case the builder tries for the perma-song/un-dispellable, especially useful for group play in low/medium PWs.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
And sometimes, as mentioned before, for skill dumps.

To do a Tumble and UMD dump.

So some build with 2 Bard, some with 3 Bard, some go for more Song bonus (because it is a combination of Bard levels and Perform), etc.  This is the main reason so many builds have different levels of Bard in them.
